info.name: Thalamus, medial cell mass
info.description: The thalamus (dorsal thalamus) is divided into medial and lateral groups of nuclei by the internal medullary lamina (a thin, curved sheet of myelinated nerve fibers).  The medial group of nuclei is much smaller in mass than the lateral group. The medial group is composed primarily of the dorsomedial (or mediodorsal) nucleus.
info.item: /Sections/Thick, Whole Brain/Coronal/ Frontal to Occipital/7 Cor: Fr to Occ
